title: feat: End sessions with explicit status
body:
This adds the `end_session_with` global and Hub functions that allow
providing an explicit `SessionStatus`.

title: fix: scope transaction name can be overriden in sentry-actix
body:
Configure the transaction name in the actix middleware at the `scope` level, instead of the event processor.

This fixes the middleware overriding the transaction name when capturing events, and allows users to set a different transaction in scope and sub-scopes.

title: fix: sentry-actix should not capture client errors
body: Client errors (4xx) should not be captured in the sentry-actix integration.

title: fix: Clean up sentry-actix toml
body: Small oversight that I missed reviewing #282

title: ref: Remove empty integrations
body: The `AnyhowIntegration` was just added in this cycle, and the log integrations were completely redesigned anyway.

title: feat: actix-web 3 support
body:
I refactored the middleware by basing it on 'official' v3 middleware (logger, cors, etc.) Some of the Sentry implementation was re-used from https://github.com/mozilla-services/autopush-rs/blob/9b93817776bb7c8f27383185a1b5ce08607a6b35/autoendpoint/src/middleware/sentry.rs (v2.0 middleware, adapted for v3.0 and `wrap`-style middleware).

Example is updated and tested locally.

Bumped minimum Rust version to 1.42.0 because that's what actix-web 3.0 targets.

Resolves #143

title: fix: Set a default environment based on debug_assertions
ref: Introduce a SessionFlusher
body:
The flusher maintains a queue that is flushed every minute.
Sessions are batched into Envelopes at this point, but in the future
might be pre-aggregated.

title: Preliminary work to integrate Performance Monitoring
body:
Hello! I'm the lead developer at [Wavy Labs Inc.](https://github.com/WavyLabs/) We're integrating Rust more and more into our stack and we've been using Sentry for over a year. We'd love to start integrating Performance Monitoring, but it seems this SDK doesn't support it yet.

I'd like to kickstart the discussion on this and contribute some developer time for this. I've been reading the [Guidelines for Tracing Support](https://develop.sentry.dev/sdk/unified-api/tracing/) and peeking into the Python SDK for reference. I've started some preliminary work on adding the new types (Span and Transaction), but I'll need some guidance on integrating with Hub. Feel free to start reviewing at any time!

title: fix: Update surf and unbreak CI
body: fixes #271

title: ci: Make testfast actually fast
body: turns out, changing RUSTFLAGS invalidates all the caches, thats why the `checkfast/fastfast` job was not using it properly.

title: ci: Use smarter cache action
body:
I spent the weekend to create a rust-tailored cache action which will:

* cache the registry index, registry cache and target folder separately and with sensible cache/restore keys
* sets `CARGO_INCREMENTAL=0`
* cleans the registry cache and target folder to only include *needed dependencies*, thus avoiding infinite cache buildup
  (this means that even noop builds will still completely rebuild *workspace crates*)
* also includes the macos cache corruption workaround

title: ref: Rearchitect the log and slog Integrations
body: In hindsight, putting all the filters/mappers on the Hub/Client-bound Integration was a mistake, and all that should be inside a lightweight logger.

title: ref: Deprecate public fields on Integrations
body: Not really sure if I should deprecate these first, or just break them right away. I don’t think people use these integrations directly a lot.

Closes #253

title: Add scope.clear_breadcrumbs()
body: The [Unified API](https://develop.sentry.dev/sdk/unified-api/) docs specify a function on the scope for clearing all current breadcrumbs. This is an implementation of that.

title: ci: Work around CI cache corruption on macOS
body: macOS check and test jobs fail with a super strange `error[E0463]: can't find crate for `serde_derive` which `chrono` depends on` error which even happens when re-running previously green runs.

title: ci: Switch to GitHub actions
body:
This runs the following actions:

* fmt + clippy
* `make checkall` + `make testfast` + cargo test
  for each combination of major 3 OSs, stable and MSRV

This currently does not report to zeus, might add back later if necessary.
Also removes the gh-pages build, as we should switch to docs.rs anyway.

title: Make contexts::utils public

body: This should fix #237, and we should backport this to 0.19 as well.

title: fix: Add an unhandled mechanism to panics
body: The "handled" prop of the exception mechanism is used in some places, for example the upcoming release health feature that will flag sessions as "crashed" if they are not handled.

title: feat: Use Envelope Endpoint and add envelope test support
meta: Add favicon to rustdoc and downgrade missing_docs warning
fix(log): Typo in readme
feat: Add basic session support
body:
This adds release health sessions to the SDK, with some things that require special attention:

* sessions live on the scope.
* sessions are forward-inherited, which means that creating a new Hub from another one, and pushing scopes will use the exact same session.
* however, sessions are not backward-inherited, which means that starting a new session will not propagate backwards to any parent scopes/hubs.

So far, intermediate session updates are sent along with normal events, however session end updates are sent on their own and not yet batched together. This means that request-mode sessions are not yet as efficient as we would like them to be.

title: fix(debug-images): Compute correct DebugId for ELF images
body:
This ports over the logic from [`symbolic`](https://github.com/getsentry/symbolic/blob/4d509d112f385daa1ec11a78e4b815e54b0dd3b6/debuginfo/src/elf.rs#L383) to compute `DebugId` from the GNU build identifier. This fixes two distinct bugs:

 1. A panic if the identifier is smaller than 16 bytes (Fixes https://github.com/getsentry/sentry-rust/issues/220)
 2. Incorrect endianness on big-endian targets.

Unfortunately, it does require a separate integration/method, since

title: Bump findshlibs to 0.7.0
body:
findshlibs 0.5.0 has a serious defect in `SharedLibrary::id`, where it
uses file sizes and offsets when examining the PT_NOTE sections of an
ELF binary instead of the memory size/offset fields. This issue was
corrected by gimli-rs/findshlibs@046a431, but was released along with a
couple of semver breaking changes so it needs a bump in Cargo.toml to be
picked up.

This has a fairly major impact on projects where you have `with_debug_meta` enabled,
as it can lead to all sorts of issues, ranging from at best corrupted crash uploads reaching
Sentry, to SEGFAULTs when a thread panics, to wild UB as we try and read from totally
random memory addresses.

We have tested this in production by patching `findshlibs` with Cargo's patch function.

I'd suggest pushing out a 0.18.1 release for this if possible, given the impact of the above.

title: ref: Rename to sentry-core and reexport
body:
This moves the *src* of `sentry` to `sentry-core`, keeping the
`examples` and `tests` in place.

The `sentry` crate now just re-exports everything, and hands over
feature flags transparently.

The doctests have a `use sentry_core as sentry` in them to not require
code changes.

title: meta: Import sentry-types into the monorepo
body:
This imports the whole sentry-types repo, including all its history.
This was done using:
```
git remote add types https://github.com/getsentry/rust-sentry-types.git
git fetch types master

… move things into the sentry-types directory, delete everything unrelated …

git commit --all
git checkout -b types-head
git checkout master
git merge types-head --allow-unrelated-histories
```

title: fix: Fix build failure on master
Fix typo in init function documentation
feat: Upgrade to new findshlibs
fix(curl): Do not loop the same data when sending with curl
body:
Good bug.

The curl transport implementation works like this:
 - Serialize the event into an in-memory buffer
 - Determine the length of the buffer and let curl read it
 - In the read function, pass a chunk into the buffer

However, the read function always sliced the beginning of the buffer, rather than reading it chunk by chunk. This is fixed by wrapping the buffer into a cursor, which implements read correctly.

title: Stop using std::sync::ONCE_INIT
body:
I've got a couple of projects that require nightly and I've started to get a deprecation warning for `std::sync::ONCE_INIT`. Docs confirm it'll be marked from 1.38 ([link](https://doc.rust-lang.org/nightly/std/sync/constant.ONCE_INIT.html)).

`Once::new()` has been around since 1.20 and since this library claims to require at least 1.31 I figured I'd be safe to switch.

title: fix: SDK identifier
fix(backtrace): Support newer backtrace format
body:
**TL;DR:** We need to resume the work on exposing `failure::Backtrace` internals.

Backtrace parsing for recent versions of `backtrace-rs` fails to obtain inline frames. The regular expression is now tidied up a little bit and supports both the old and new backtrace format in one go, along with inline frames. 

Additionally, crate name parsing was broken for the new Rust mangling schema, which no longer uses underscores in front of trait implementors and uses `::` instead of `..` for crate separators.

title: feat: Make openssl optional
body: Trial to make #137 work

title: feat: add support for openssl-less builds
body:
This issue is related to #88 and would prevent issues like it when
openssl 1.2 comes out.

Currently, sentry-rust depends on reqwest with default feature flags,
which pulls in `native-tls` and `openssl`.

This causes multiple issues:

1. On systems without openssl header packages installed, openssl-sys
   won't build.
2. If distributions like arch linux update to newer versions of openssl,
   issues like #88 will arise
3. Systems that don't support openssl are not supported (although
   targeting embedded systems with non-unix OSes is probably not a goal
   in this project)

This commit adds support for building reqwest with rustls support, using
the new feature flag ~~`rustls`~~ `with_rustls`.

This fixes #136.

- The new field will cause compiler error if LoggerOptions is instantiated without defaults. The possible fix is very simple and straightforward but a version bump is still needed.

title: Fix config LoggerOptions::emit_breadcrumbs, value never read, #125.
Name sender thread spawned by Sentry client.
body:
- Well behaved code should always name all spawned threads. It's to simplify debugging (`pstree -t PID`), the names are written to logs etc.
- `.unwrap()` may cause panic which is bad, but the same one was already in the original `thread::spawn()`. Fix would require API change which is out of scope of this update.
- Examples weren't touched to make them short and simple.

title: feat: Support for curl and disabled transports

This pull request provides two features: disabling all built in transports
and using curl as an optional transport instead of reqwest.

This should cut down on a lot of extra dependencies for users that do not
want to pull in all of tokio.

title: ref: Upgrade to Rust Edition 2018

title: Combined panic/failure integration
body:
It would be useful to have a way to turn a `failure::Error` into a panic without losing the backtrace.

This is very common when you receive an error from further down the call-stack, and you don't have a good way to handle it, but currently you only get a callstack to the panic location, you lose the underlying error's backtrace.

This is just one possible way to implement the functionality.
